Utterance: <sync>
Hi, it’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, I’ve been okay. A bit anxious, but overall, I’m managing.
That’s understandable. You mentioned feeling more positive last time. Has that continued?
Yeah, I think so. I’ve had some good days, but there are still moments where I feel overwhelmed.
Can you tell me more about those overwhelming moments?
Well, sometimes it’s just little things, like being in a crowded place or having too much on my to-do list. It can just hit me suddenly.
It sounds like those situations trigger your anxiety. Have you tried any coping strategies when that happens?
I’ve been trying to practice deep breathing. It helps a little, but it’s hard to remember to do it in the moment.
That’s a great start. Perhaps we can work on integrating that into your routine. Would you like to try a mindfulness exercise together now?
Sure, I’d like that.
Okay, let’s take a few deep breaths together. Inhale deeply… and exhale slowly. Focus on your breath. How does that feel?
It feels nice. I can feel my shoulders relaxing a bit.
That’s wonderful. Practicing this regularly can help you manage those overwhelming feelings better. Would you be open to setting a goal to practice this daily?
Yeah, I could try that. Maybe in the morning or before bed?
Both are great times! You could also try it during those overwhelming moments if you remember. How does that sound?
That sounds good. I’ll definitely give it a shot.
Great! You also mentioned wanting to help others through sex education. How is that going for you?
I’ve been looking into programs and classes, but I’m still unsure about committing.
It’s okay to take your time. What’s holding you back from committing?
I guess I’m worried that I won’t be good enough or that I’ll fail.
Those feelings are valid. It’s common to feel that way when pursuing something important. What would you say to a friend who felt that way?
I’d probably tell them that it’s okay to make mistakes and that they should just try their best.
Exactly! You deserve that same kindness. How can you apply that advice to yourself?
I think I need to remind myself that it’s a process and that I can learn along the way.
That’s a great perspective. What small steps could you take to move forward with this goal?
Maybe I could start by attending a few workshops or volunteering somewhere.
That sounds like an excellent plan! Taking small steps can help build your confidence. Would you like to set a timeline for that?
Yeah, I could aim to find something in the next month.
Perfect! Let’s check in on that in our next session. How does that feel?
That feels good. I like having a plan.
I’m glad to hear that! Now, let’s talk about your relationship with your boyfriend. You mentioned having some arguments. How have things been since then?
We’ve been okay. We still have our moments, but I think we’re getting better at communicating.
That’s great progress! What strategies have you found helpful in your communication?
We’ve been trying to talk things out more calmly instead of arguing right away.
That’s a healthy approach. Have you noticed any changes in how you both handle disagreements?
Yeah, I think we’re both more willing to listen to each other now.
Listening is key in any relationship. What else do you think can improve your communication?
Maybe being more open about how we’re feeling instead of waiting for things to escalate.
That sounds like a solid plan. How can you encourage that openness?
I could start by sharing my feelings first and encouraging him to do the same.
That’s a wonderful idea! Creating a safe space for both of you to express yourselves can strengthen your relationship.
I hope so. I really want us to be able to talk about anything.
It’s a great goal to have. As you work on this, remember to be patient with yourselves. It takes time to develop these skills.
Yeah, I’ll keep that in mind.
Before we wrap up today, is there anything else you’d like to discuss or any concerns you have?
I think we’ve covered a lot. I’m feeling good about the mindfulness practice and my goals.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, you’re doing great work. Let’s plan to touch base on your goals and mindfulness practice next time.
Sounds good! Thank you!
You’re welcome! Take care, and I look forward to seeing you next week.
Bye!
